title: Apigee - Declare dependencies
abstract:
# Apigee - Declare dependencies
**    Preview    — Apigee API hub ** This feature is subject to the "Pre-GA Offerings Terms" in the General Service Terms section   of the [Service Specific Terms](/terms/service-terms#1) .     Pre-GA features are available "as is" and might have limited support.    For more information, see the [launch stage descriptions](/products#product-launch-stages) .
**Required permissions:** You must have [administrator permissions](/apigee/docs/api-hub/permissions#roles) to view the **Settings** page and declare dependencies.
The following panes appear at the bottom of the [ API Overview](/apigee/docs/api-hub/explore-overview) page and provide links to indicate information related to the API:
- **Related:** Miscellaneous information related to the API
- **Dependencies:** Any dependencies of the API that may be   relevant, including internal APIs, external third-party APIs, and other production systems
You can define multiple sections or types of related links. These types are backed by a system [taxonomy](/apigee/docs/api-hub/taxonomies) which can be modified to allow for  flexibility in the organizational structure. A special taxonomy is defined  by the system that allows you to specify only internal API dependencies, which enables the  system to infer the API dependency relationships throughout API hub.

## Related
The **Related** pane displays links to miscellaneous information related to the API.  For example, source code repository, design documentation, or infrastructure systems.
All information in the **Related** pane is manually defined. You can [add](#add-related) , [edit](#edit-related) , [delete](#delete-related) , and [order](#order-related) ** Related** information.
### Add Related
To add items to the **Related** pane:
- In the Google Cloud console, go to the **API hub** page. [Go to API hub](https://console.cloud.google.com/apigee/hub/apis) The **APIs** list page is displayed by default.
- From **APIs** list, click an API row. The **Overview** tab is   displayed by default.
- In the **Related** pane, clickedit **Edit** .
- Specify the following:- **Source code:** - Click **Add source code** .
- Specify a **Name** .
- Specify a **URL** .
- **Example Organization APIs:** **Note:** The organization name displayed here is the organization name you    define in [Customize the display](/apigee/docs/api-hub/customize-display) .    In this case, the organization name is "Example Organization".- Click **Add Example Organization API** .
- Select an API from the list.
- **Other:** - Click **Add other** .
- Specify an API **Name** .
- Specify a **URL** to use for API calls.
- Click **Save** (or **Cancel** ).
### Edit Related
To edit items in the **Related** pane:
- In the Cloud console, go to the **API hub** page. [Go to API hub](https://console.cloud.google.com/apigee/hub/apis) The **APIs** list page is displayed by default.
- From **APIs** list, click an API row. The **Overview** tab is   displayed by default.
- In the **Related** pane, clickedit **Edit** .
- Make modifications as necessary.
- Click **Save** (or **Cancel** ).
### Delete Related
To delete items from the **Related** pane:
- In the Cloud console, go to the **API hub** page. [Go to API hub](https://console.cloud.google.com/apigee/hub/apis) The **APIs** list page is displayed by default.
- From **APIs** list, click an API row. The **Overview** tab is   displayed by default.
- In the **Related** pane, clickedit **Edit** .
- Clickdelete **Delete** next to the desired   item.
- Click **Delete** (or **Cancel** ) in the confirmation dialog.
- Click **Save** (or **Cancel** ).
### Order Related
To order items in the **Related** pane:
- In the Cloud console, go to the **API hub** page. [Go to API hub](https://console.cloud.google.com/apigee/hub/apis) The **APIs** list page is displayed by default.
- From **APIs** list, click an API row. The **Overview** tab is   displayed by default.
- In the **Related** pane, clickedit **Edit** .
- Clickexpand_more **Move down** orexpand_less **Move up** next to the desired item.
- Click **Save** (or **Cancel** ).## Dependencies
The **Dependencies** pane lists all dependencies of the API, including other internal APIs  (present in API hub), external third-party APIs (not present in API hub), and other  production systems (for example, databases and storage solutions).
All information in the **Dependencies** pane is manually defined. You can [add](#add-dependency) , [edit](#edit-dependency) , [delete](#delete-dependency) , and [order](#order-dependency)  **Dependencies** .

- From **APIs** list, click an API row. The **Overview** tab is   displayed by default.
- In the **Dependencies** pane, clickedit **Edit** .
- Specify the following:- **Example Organization APIs:** **Note:** The organization name displayed here is the organization name you    define in [Customize the display](/apigee/docs/api-hub/customize-display) .    In this case, the organization name is "Example Organization".- Click **Add example organization API** .
- Select an API from the list.
- **3rd party APIs:** - Click **Add 3rd party APIs** .
- Specify an API **Name** .
- Specify a **URL** to use for API calls.
- **Other:** - Click **Add other** .
- Specify an API **Name** .
- Specify a **URL** to use for API calls.
- Click **Save** (or **Cancel** ).
